communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Records Request - GTL and smartinmate.com Revenue
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Can I please request the financial income/financial statements for Lee County and/or the county sheriff's office is receiving From GTL and smartinmate.com . Please provide the last 12 months if records.

There should not be any fees associated pertaining to this request, I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment and/or download link as per Sunshine Law.

Sincerely,

Mason C. turner

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandra Collins- Granite City, Illinois
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern:

I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against the actions of individuals involved in the watchlist operation, which I believe have resulted in the commission of unlawful acts. It has come to my attention that certain individuals associated with the watchlist operation are engaging in tactics such as man-in-the-middle cyber attacks to obstruct, manipulate, and misrepresent communications, particularly when submitting online reports to the Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General, Attorneys, and other Government entities. For the sake of transparency and accountability, I am submitting this complaint through Muck Rock to ensure that the public is informed of my concerns and to facilitate the proper filing and tracking of this complaint.

My involvement in this matter stems from being unjustly placed on a watchlist subsequent to my disclosure of misconduct within the Radiology Department at Mercy Hospital in Creve Coeur, Missouri. I strongly believe that I obtain proof and may have witnesses that substantiates my claim.

I am writing to you with regard to my 6 year wrongful inclusion in a watchlist under the jurisdiction of the Granite City Police Department and the Saint Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group (STLFC). I have reason to believe that I have been subjected to various forms of abuse, harassment, and exploitation as a result of this inclusion. This grievance pertains specifically to the actions of individuals within the Saint Louis Fusion Center, as well as its collaborative partners in State, Local, Tribal, Territorial Law Enforcement (F/SLTT), Air National Guard, and private sector partners.

It has come to my attention that the Saint Louis Fusion Center and affiliates, in conjunction with programs established by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), such as the St. Louis Urban Area Security Initiative (UASI), has engaged in practices that have violated established security protocols, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), and federal laws, notably the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act, 18 USC SEC 1030.

Additionally, I have been subjected to unfair treatment that includes one or more persons acting under color of law willfully depriving and conspiring to deprive me of my rights protected by the constitution. This misconduct goes beyond mere allegations of negligence commonly associated with law enforcement collaborations with Fusion Centers.
I have reason to believe that certain individuals associated with the operation have inappropriately disseminated my personal information for fraudulent purposes, potentially for personal gain, thereby compromising my privacy and potentially exposing me to unwarranted harm. These actions have not only caused me distress but have also raised serious concerns regarding the integrity and legality of the operations carried out by the Saint Louis Fusion Center and its affiliates. Moreover, I am deeply troubled by the revelation that there are instances of misuse of telecommunications satellites and systems, which may pose a threat to security and integrity. I have reason to believe that these individuals have been using intelligence tactics to instill fear and create a sense of insecurity.

During the course of this operation, I have experienced instances of cruel and unusual punishment, including sexual misconduct, harassment, bodily injuries, discrimination, exploitation, mail tampering, and medical violations due to the arbitrary exercise of power. Furthermore, I have encountered Intelligence operators who have been involved in concealing, altering, and destroying evidence relevant to the situation. Additionally, these operators have intercepted telephone lines in an attempt to hinder me from reporting the illicit activities to government authorities and attorneys.

As a law-abiding citizen, I expect that my rights and privacy are protected by those tasked with upholding the law. It is disheartening to discover that I have become a victim of misconduct and negligence within a system that is meant to safeguard the well-being of its citizens.

I urge your office to conduct a thorough investigation into these allegations and take the necessary steps to rectify any injustices that have been inflicted upon me.

Your expertise and oversight in this matter are crucial to ensuring the integrity and effectiveness of our national security systems. Your prompt attention to this request is greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your dedicated service and commitment to upholding the highest standards of accountability and security in our government operations.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Collins

Alexandra Collins
Granite City, Illinois 62040-2013

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Official Job Description Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. I request all official job descriptions posted and used to hire staff under job requisition #301351.
2. I request all official job descriptions posted and used to hire staff under job requisition #301638.
3. I request all official job descriptions posted and used to hire staff under job requisition #303498.

By referring to an "official job description," I am referring to the type of job description and information documenting specific responsibilities unique to the department hiring the personnel and the qualifications (required and preferred) that were used to hire potential candidates for these jobs. Please ensure that the information provided is specific to the positions advertised under each requisition number and does not include general job classification descriptions.

Please name or identify which files you upload apply to each requisition # above.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

InfoInquirer

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: RE: FOIL REQUEST | TOHAS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Animal Intake and Disposition (2023-24)

    ○ Monthly totals of Cats and Dogs received by TOHAS for each month of the calendar year 2023-24.

    ○ Disposition of each animal, categorized as follows:

        • Returned to owner
        • Adopted
        • Died (natural causes)
        • Euthanized
        • Transferred out (including the name and contact information of the receiving organization)

2. Animal Care Policies and Procedures

    ○ All Standard Operating Procedures ("SOPs") in effect at any time during 2023-24 for the care and treatment of shelter animals, covering:

        • Feeding and water provision
        • Medical and behavioral care
        • Socialization and enrichment
        • Euthanasia policies and protocols
        • Staff training and qualification requirements

3. Placement Partner Organizations (PPO) Policies and Procedures

    ○ All SOPs in effect at any time during 2023-24 regarding collaborations with PPOs, including but not limited to:

        • Criteria for selecting PPOs
        • Processes for facilitating animal transfers
        • Follow-up or tracking procedures for animals placed with PPOs

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Colon

title: Air Permits for Electricity Genberators in Houston, Texas

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:
This letter constitutes a request under the Texas Public Information Act, on behalf of
Targeted Justice Inc.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be
provided to Targeted Justice:

1. Records and documents pertaining to the permits issued under the Clean Air Act for all portable and emergency generators located in or servicing cell towers in the Houston, Texas area as of May 17, 2024. The information to be provided shall include at a minimum the following:

a - Permit Holder Name
b - Exact location (address) of generator
c - Generator make, year and capacity
d - First permit date issuance 
e- Current permit date issuance and expiration.
f - Identity of carrier or customer to be serviced by generator.

The term “document” is to be liberally construed to include any file, paper, microfilm, digital archive, or  any other format where the information sought may be stored. As you know, the Public Information Act requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest.  Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. 

Request for expedited processing

Targeted Justice currently has over 15,000 subscribers and over 115,000 thousands views a month in its
Substack newsletter. Thus, it is considered a news media organization  Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. 

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that it has no commercial interest other than informing the public about matters of public concern. 

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use.

For any document you fail to produce, Targeted Justice requests that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 832-247-3046 or 281-772-7668. Thank you for your consideration of my request.

Sincerely,

Ana L. Toledo for Targeted Justice, Inc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Targeted Justice

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS: Personnel Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals:

* Adam Loredo, teacher at Hawthorne Scholastic, previously at Ogden International
* Rashad Talley, interim principal at Wendell Phillips
* Joshua Vander Jagt, ex-Principal at Ogden, Assistant Principal at Hyde Park Academy
* Jezail Jackson, teacher at Wendell Phillips, previously at Ogden International
* Holly Caldwell, Assistant Principal at Wendell Phillips 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, describing or relating to Distributed Denial of Secrets, abbreviated DDoSecrets. 

DDoSecrets is a non-profit whistleblower site founded in 2018 for news leaks which is sometimes referred to as a successor to WikiLeaks and came to international attention for its June 2020 publication of police documents, known as BlueLeaks. 

You may limit the search to between December 2018 and the date the search is performed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

communications.subject: Clarification of your FOIA request
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, Julieta Cardenas

The USDA Office of Information Affairs (OIA) has received the attached FOIA request you submitted online. As a preliminary matter, your request is overly broad and will need refining in order to perform a search.

We do not have the ability to perform a broad, agency-wide search of all email accounts under the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture, including all staff. We would like to narrow the request to specific record custodians, if possible.  Would you be amenable to limiting your request to a search of specific named custodians accounts under the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture? With that narrowing, we would be able to proceed with processing of your request.

If you have any questions or would like to discuss narrowing your request, please feel free to reach out by email or at the number below.

Please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you,



[cid:image001.png@01DAA864.614AD0E0]
Olga Colacicco
FOIA Analyst Contractor
Freedom of Information Act Division
Office of Information Affairs
U.S. Department of Agriculture
1400 Independence Ave., SW
Washington, DC  20250

title: Ohio IPHIS_EDRS Birth and Death Index

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio IPHIS_EDRS Birth and Death Index
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Public Records Act, Ohio Revised Code § 149.43, I am writing to request access to and a copy of the birth and death index from 1908 to the present day. Specifically, I am interested in obtaining a copy of the database from your Integrated Perinatal Health Information System and the Electronic Death Registration System (IPHIS-EDRS).

As stated in Ohio Revised Code § 149.43(B)(1), “all public records responsive to the request shall be promptly prepared and made available for inspection to any person at all reasonable times during regular business hours.” Moreover, the Ohio Revised Code defines public records broadly to include any document, device, or item, regardless of physical form or characteristic, created or received by or coming under the jurisdiction of any public office that documents the organization, functions, policies, decisions, procedures, operations, or other activities of the office.

Please inform me of any costs associated with fulfilling this request. I am willing to pay any reasonable fees for the processing of this request. If the cost exceeds $50, please contact me with an estimate before proceeding. However, if it is feasible, I would appreciate a fee waiver as this request is for the interest of the public and non-commercial educational purposes.

If my request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including the legal authority upon which the denial is based, as required by Ohio Revised Code § 149.43(B)(3).

I appreciate your time and attention to this matter and look forward to your prompt response. Should you have any questions or require further clarification regarding my request, please do not hesitate to reply.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

Jonah

title: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whom it may concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c. 66, §10, for public records in the custody of your organization. The Center for Public Interest Advocacy and Collaboration is an educational, research and advocacy organization at Northeastern University School of Law. We produce publicly available interdisciplinary research and data analysis on important social issues.

We request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

             1. Cross tabulated counts of 51A reports filed against children, ages 3-18 in school years 2018- 
                   2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
                               a. School
                               b. Category of reporter (mandated or non-mandated)
                               c. Age of the child
                               d. Race of the child
                               e. Ethnicity of the child
                               f. Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child
                               g. Disability status of the child
                               h. Type of abuse or neglect alleged
             2. Intersectional counts of 51A reports filed against parents in school years 2018-2019, 2019- 
                2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
                               a. School of the child
                               b. Race of the parent
                               c. Ethnicity of the parent
                               d. Type of abuse or neglect alleged

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). If you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law
connor.mak@northeastern.edu
(508) 340-1740

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor

Andrew Free

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any agency documents related to the American author John Simmons Barth and his novel "Sabbatical: A Love Story" published in 1982. Barth (born: May 27th, 1980 - died: April 2nd, 2024) published a novel called "Sabbatical: A Love Story" that was inspired by the death of agency employee John Paisley. 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2024/04/02/john-barth-author-dead-obituary/

Of particular interest is any agency correspondence (either to or from) the following agency officials that mention John Barth and "Sabbatical: A Love Story" or allude to the book publicizing the John Paisley episode:

William J. Casey 
Bobby Ray Inman
Frank Carlucci
John M. McMahon
Robert Gates

In addition, conduct a search of correspondence (either to or from) an agency public affairs or media representative that discussed John Barth or his writings. Please also conduct a search of any agency collection of news reports regarding John Barth and his writings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: John Barth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records related to the American author John Simmons Barth (May 27th, 1930 to April 2nd, 2024). Barth's recent death was widely reported in the mainstream media, with The Washington Post publishing a detailing obituary. Barth was a long time resident of the state of Maryland. The bureau might have maintained a file on Barth due to his novel "Sabbatical: A Romance" published in 1982. 

This request is for any and all records about my the American author John Simmons Barth from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Barth held by the Baltimore Field Office. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to John Simmons Barth.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to John Simmons Barth. 

Please include a search of any records or documents understood to be, or colloquially referred to as "COINTELPRO records" under the bureau's custody that could be construed as responsive to a request for records related to John Simmons Barth. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or if certain portions must be redacted, please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports (Dr. William W. Henderson Inclusion School)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on 51A Reports (Dr. William W. Henderson Inclusion School)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c. 66, §10, for public records in the custody of your organization. The Center for Public Interest Advocacy and Collaboration is an educational, research and advocacy organization at Northeastern University School of Law. We produce publicly available interdisciplinary research and data analysis on important social issues.

We request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1.	Cross-tabulated counts of 51A reports filed against children, ages 3-18 in school years 2022-2023, 2023-2024 broken down by
         a.	Category of reporter (mandated or non-mandated) 
         b.	Age of the child 
         c.	Race of the child
         d.	Ethnicity of the child
         e.	Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child 
         f.	Disability status of the child 
         g.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
2.	Intersectional counts of 51A reports filed against parents in school years 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, 2022-2023, broken down by
         a.	Race of the parent
         b.	Ethnicity of the parent
         c.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
3.	The standard operating procedures of the Office of Equity at Henderson and its role in creating and maintaining procedures for mandatory reporting and filing of 51As since its inception 

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). If you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Norrie Osgood
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law
osgood.n@northeastern.edu 
(603) 848-2018
